website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive, reasonably lightweight truck that is worth considering for light loads. However, the 400-pound weight limit is questionable considering the subpar wheels that are prone to breakage.
pros: Somewhat lighter than some similar models, thanks to the glass-filled nylon truss
Easy to adjust positions once assembled
Falls on the lower end of the price spectrum
cons: Plastic wheels aren't built for heavy-duty hauling, and have been reported to break or fall off

website_summaries.verdict: A versatile, affordably priced dolly. The best value on the market.
pros: Can be used vertically or as a load platform
cons: Occasional incidents of missing parts and castor breakages

customer_reviews.title: Be wary of this Item plastic wheels break
customer_reviews.text: This product is rated for 400 pounds on four wheels I bought this product to cart my music equipment around including a PA system that I bought in the same order One of the wheels the casters specifically broke already because there were very cheaply made plastic they should be up in steal orrubber there's no way that I exceeded the weight requirement not even by half now I don't know what to do I can't send it back because I don't have the packaging and I have to re-engineer myself and fix it
customer_reviews.author: Londog99

customer_reviews.title: Great dolly - very easy to assemble, with a good, wide base.
customer_reviews.text: Great dolly - very easy to assemble. Works great, sturdy, and easily adjustible. I thought I'd provide some pics of the product, as arrived, and the assembly process. In total, from opening the original packing, to being able to use it, took approximately 15 minutes. You'll need two wrenches (they really should have included two of those cheapo, "throw away" wrenches for the four bolts) and maybe needle-nose pliers for the two cotter pins, as well, for the two wheels, but that's it. I just moved a 250 lb. filing cabinet after assembling it, and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: TomHunter1968

customer_reviews.title: Initially great, but wheels don't last
customer_reviews.text: After sending this back TWICE due to missing parts, we thought this would be perfect for light duty hauling. However, after only 5 times of use with 200lb loads in the dolly configuration, the swivel wheels completely came apart. We will be switching to the Milwaukee hand truck!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product however I really dislike spending a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product however I really dislike spending a lot of money on something then have to spend a lot of time and effort assembing something especially when the bar that goes between the wheels don't line up into the holes and there is and extremely small margin to get the pins into to hold in the wheels. It should clearly say...assembly required for the price of $80 some thing dollars. Took me an hour to assemble with a lot of swearing in between. I should be paid to spend that kind of time to assemble some thing. Grrrrrrrr. I won't do that again.
customer_reviews.author: Anne B.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Easy To Switch Style.
customer_reviews.text: This "Dolly" "Hand Truck" whatever you prefer to call it, works great !! Switching it from a dolly to a lay-down style cart is absolutely easy as pie. I do recommend that if you plan on using this for anything besides hard surfaces like concrete or pavement that you purchase upgraded wheels/tires to the type that are inflatable. You can purchase them on Amazon for just a few bucks (approx. $10-$15).
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Has pros and cons. Assembly is the worst part
customer_reviews.text: After assembly, product works well, exactly as described. Assembly is painful. Doesn’t include assembly tools, doesn’t really use standard assembly tools, so you need to improvise what you need or go buy a new tool set. They do give you contact information to this truck company(?) that’ll handle assembly and returns, but I think that’s an unnecessary, inconvenient extra step. Doesn’t really store well. I was somehow under the impression that this is compact and/or somewhat-foldable, but it’s really just what it is.
customer_reviews.author: ABC_chocolate

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time yesterday. Loaded it with less than 300lbs of weight. I was wheeling it on the sidewalk and hit a small crack in the pavement and small right front wheel collapsed! That's the most important thing in the cart and they can't get that right.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great cart for carrying around heavy items
customer_reviews.text: Recently, I've started a business that required heavy lifting, and didn't want to use the manual labor. So, I bought this dolly to help out with my everyday uses and it has been a big help. I really like it's ability to switch from a cart to a dolly, very versatile and sturdy. Would definitely recommend to anyone that has a heavy workload and would like to have a little help with their job.
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen Tran

customer_reviews.title: Things slide off the the four wheeling mode Need Bungie's!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used 35gal plastic bin to move I stacked 3 high right when i went down the step all bins fall off in the street.. YOU NEED BUNGIE'S OR SOME KIND OF IN PLACE SUPPORT OR EVERYTHING GOES SLIPPING RIGHT OFF! REAL SLIPPERY ITS ONLY GOOD FOR MOVING ON FLAT SURFACES NOT STEPS OR GRASS JUST SIDE WALKS. BUT THATS NOT ALWAY THE CASE WHEN MOVING TO AN APPT. WITH STEPS AND GRASS. BUT IL KEEP FOR GROCERIES. BUT IT WAS ALOT BETTER TAN CARRY MOST OF MY THINGS BY HAND.
customer_reviews.author: Gourmetnell66

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product but the assembly instruction must be revised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to move around book boxes room to room. I am happy with that. However, I recommend to revise the assembly instruction: 1. Put axle 2. attach base plate (bolt out to inside) 3. assemble tires. 4. tighten bolts and nuts. However, the current instruction is in the order of 2,1,3,4. The problem is that if you attach the base plate first, the axle is likely to be stuck. I had to disassemble base plate and put axle first. also...if there was no instruction, if you put the bolts in to out, there is a chance that nuts touch the tire.
customer_reviews.author: COCl2

customer_reviews.title: Decent hand truck
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is light weight and does a pretty good job moving things. It's not great on stairs. The best hand trucks have sliders, most don't, but they're also five times the price and much heavier. This also has no strap to hold things on the truck. I used a tie down but it was only somewhat effective, I'll have to think about the best way to do that.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Broken wheel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hand truck in November. My wife and Daughter used it for the first tims last weekend to move a few light boxes to a home and garden show in Johnson City, TN and the plastic wheel broke in half. The boxes were less than a 100 lbs. Guess it really wasn't made for 400lbs. Can not recommend anyone buying this dolly.
customer_reviews.author: TxRanger

customer_reviews.title: Great Product that works.
customer_reviews.text: I recently helped a friend move a fireproof gun safe from his truck to a closet in the back of his place. OMG! that was heavy! we'd have never be able to get that thing moved if I didn't have this dolly. If I had one thing to complain about is that unlike dolly's you get from moving companies that have these roller track things on the back to help you with stairs. This product doesn't have that feature. Maybe that should be in the upgraded or newer version. Otherwise I really like having it around, It stores easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gillis

customer_reviews.title: Don't read the negative reviews this thing was outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This Dolly gets a lot of bad rap and I don't understand I used it to move a 700 lb shed in four boxes and this thing work like a breeze! I am a short woman and I have many health issues and this thing saved my day could not be happier!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: I spent more for less!
customer_reviews.text: This cart costs almost $20 less than a shopping cart i got and i can tell already it's going to work as needed. I'm going to use it as the wheels for getting my food home on a bus. This cart says it can support 400lbs and i think it can. I stood on it without any problems.(This cart doesn't have wheel locks so don't try it. Not the safe thing to do.) I weigh 260lbs and the frame didn't show any flex at all. I think the caster wheels will be great inside the supper market but might not work as well on uneven ground.(bumpy sidewalks) I just wish i saw this first!
customer_reviews.author: David Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not the greatest or strongest.
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done in light to medium work loads. It is not very durable and it is not very large to balance or leverage heavier or larger items on. The wheel fell off within the first hour of use and after that it was never the same. Fortunately we only needed it for one move, you would never want to use this more than a few times and only for light duty.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised it wasn’t already put together. I mean the box was large enough to just slap the thing together what’s the big deal? So you can see how excited I was to put it together? Honestly they either the terrible set of directions it was pretty easy I asked for help but of course my life I didn’t get an ounce even the cat slept through me putting this thing together. I made it. It was a piece of cake, I mean cake wouldn’t been more fun but go figure I needed the dolly more than the cake.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: make sure all parts line up for easy insertion.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like that the holes to insert the bolts through the handle didn't line up properly. When inserting the yellow bar (the handle) the holes in it didn't line up with the holes in the truck facing forward. When you turn it backwards it would line up easy and the bolts would slip right in. When using it as a flat bed the insertion process of the bolts is easy. So we decided not to use it as a hand cart in the upright position, but to use it as a flatbed that we load and pull.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: Junk quality and YOU are the assembler.
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk and manufactured in Wichita, KS and proclaimed to be made in America...if this is what Americans make we are in serious trouble. The axle that is supposed to connect the wheels needs to be pounded through with a hammer due to the flashing on the wheels. There are other examples of fasteners not lining up and in order to assemble you must be prepared to have a hammer and a punch to assist with items., Would have been much easier to go to a big box hardware store and pay the same price for a better item. Don't waste your time or money on this item
customer_reviews.author: Scott Falcone

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all !
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it twice. The second time, the small wheel broken down. I don't know where I can find the replacement. Very sad, $70 bucks is a waste if I only use it for two times.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Preece

customer_reviews.title: Great, versatile plastic dolly.
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for moving furniture, moving boxes of all sizes, and landscaping supplies. The body of the dolly is strong plastic while the yellow arm is metal. I'm not very tall, so the adjustable height has been helpful moving small heavy things around, then adjusting taller for awkwardly tall/long boxes. The cart option has worked great for us for moving landscaping things around like heavy tile as well. Very easy to use and light weight. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this more than I thought I would. Mostly in the cart mode. The handle rattles a little bit because it is only held in place by two clips, but it is still pretty sturdy. UPS and FedEx drivers both have complemented on it and asked where they could get one. I'd buy it again. It's holds a lot of weight. My only complaint would be the bottom lip is too small to use it as a dolly for any large boxes. But works great as a cart.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartment
customer_reviews.text: We recently downsized into an apartment, and now must carry groceries through a parking garage, up an elevator, and to the end of the hall. This is a great, compact solution to reducing trips - we put it in the dolly configuration with a couple plastic tubs, and one trip typically gets everything from the car to the apartment. We store it in a hall closet, in the hand truck configuration, which takes very little space. Changing the configuration takes 30 seconds: remove two pins, reposition the handle, put the two pins in. The pins have fallen out a couple times, so we check and retrace our steps if needed; so far we haven't lost them.
customer_reviews.author: PeterPla

customer_reviews.title: paint defect and difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Okay for light work. Hard to assemble due to tight tolerances (eg: very difficult to work w/ cotter pins: recommend spread w/ flat head screwdriver tip once in place and then use needle nose pliers to spread) and assembly points not really lining up (eg: have to bend axle bar to fit it to frame and attach wheels. Wheels don't track straight = questionable long-term service. Also, corner area of handle w/ paint defect (under-sprayed = missing paint). No contact from company RE customer satisfaction report after more than a week past delivery.
customer_reviews.author: SteamyR

customer_reviews.title: It arrived short of pieces...
customer_reviews.text: I emptied the box, pulled out the instructions and began assembling the product. 2 wheels, the nuts and bolts but only 1 washer and one cotter pin for 1 wheel. Don't you people check to make sure ALL The parts for assembly are there? Now I have to go out into the dangerous unmasked world of selfish people during a global pandemic - to find the replacement parts so I can use this to MOVE! Thanks for nothing, I won't be reordering from this company ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Bondanza-Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: wheels are all plastic, says it can hold 400lbs ...
customer_reviews.text: wheels are all plastic, says it can hold 400lbs when on all 4 wheels. they broke after 100lbs cabinet rode on it, tore them to pieces,
customer_reviews.author: Mom-2-Five-n-TX

customer_reviews.title: Capable of more than I'd thought
customer_reviews.text: I restore/refinish vintage/antique furniture, build custom orders, and do a lot of home improvement...but also have rheumatoid arthritis, however, am very stubborn and independent. I bought this to help me move things around due to it's ability to convert positions & weight capacity. Easy to assemble & easy to convert when using. The stair glides are easy to beat up, at least it didn't take me long too. Has definitely made my life a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cart for my Needs
customer_reviews.text: I got this cart to move a 133 pound portable (wheel-less) generator around and it handles that generator without any issues. Easy to convert it back and forth between two wheel and four wheel operation. I was a little leery of the smaller wheels from other reviews but I found them to be very sturdy. After hurricane season I will use the cart to move mulch bags and other gardening needs around. I like its versatility.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: ( I really wanted this to work out because I hate going through the hassle of returning things and I ...
customer_reviews.text: maybe I shouldn't be so harsh but...I regret getting this hand truck. The axle is too short and I cant get the wheels and washers to stay on with the colter pin - and have the wheels roll. :( I really wanted this to work out because I hate going through the hassle of returning things and I am single now and I need something that helps me move some of the heavier items from one place to another. I guess I will just have to suck it up, pack it up, and ship it back because this is not working for me.
customer_reviews.author: CynInAz

customer_reviews.title: Will eventually give out and the bolts fell out
customer_reviews.text: I had this cart for about 1 year and the bolts fell out. Also, it surely does carry 400lbs when flat. However, it does not support the weight well. After many many uses of approximately 8 cases of paper on it, which doesn't quite equal to 400lbs, one of the supporting wheels gave out. I have not been able to find replacements for the wheel. My cart now rattles because it is missing a bolt at the bottom, the other one I had to tie with a secure binding strip. Long story short, good for approximately 200lb for constant use. Do not place too much weight and the bolts won't fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Villegas

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment. Moved everything by myself.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a move rather than rent one since this is relatively inexpensive. I used this for a move to a new place. This handled a king mattress, queen mattress, dressers(probably weighing 80lbs), and a sofa with no issues. I like the fact I can switch this around into a hand truck and a dolly, and completely remove the handle if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Portable and a great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on multiple occasions, with the most load being ~40lbs. Very useful for making bulky moves a 1-man job. The adjusting mechanism for the handlebars could be better designed (a bit clunky taking out and replacing the pins) but all said, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Uche

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Thsi is just a review about wonderful customer service at Harpers Trucks, Inc. I thought I was missing the axle when I went to assemble it and was going through the included parts. I could not find it. I called company. Never had a co. answer so fast (maybe one ring) Pleasantly connected me to some who told me axle was taped to the side of the dolly. She even, again pleasantly, waited while I went to another room to check. There it was as she said. So nice to be treated so well.
customer_reviews.author: rose marie seekamp

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to move things around
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to move things around, I was able to move a 400LB refrigerator which was at the limits and it got the job done. The only thing i didn't like is that I wished it was a little wider but it was ok overall, you can use it as a dolly and as a card, very happy with the purchase. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Leftian

customer_reviews.title: Lots of strength,  tiny package
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my minivan/cargo carrier. It is very slightly bulky, but always fits. I can carry around 10 times the load vs the collapsible push cart I had bought from a different vendor. It never feels like it will fall over. The only thing I would change are the pins. They are easily lost, and I believe a quick release clip would have worked better
customer_reviews.author: Cheri L. Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Moved a gun safe with it. 'Nuff said.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dolly a few years ago and it has come in very handy several times. What pushed my over the edge to actually write a review about it is the fact that today I used this plastic dolly to move a 340 lb gun safe by myself. Granted, it was already in my house and it was all flat terrain, but still, super impressed with it. I will say, the rating for the 2 wheel configuration is only 300 lbs, so I can't recommend you do the same, but I will say that it did work for me.
customer_reviews.author: WavesOfFury

customer_reviews.title: Worthless plastic garbage
customer_reviews.text: We bought two. We assembled one and went to assemble the other and there was no hardware... great... So we went to use the one we assembled and... it’s GARBAGE!... The pin to hold handle falls out, it warps if you load anything remotely heavy. I am sending both back, they are both equally useless. DO. NOT. BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: best dolly
customer_reviews.text: being widow of 76 years old woman......this dolly was the best thing i ever bought, i needed to move dresser, with some pull and tag i managed to move it. this dolly has wheels that worked smooth and havy thing made light enough for me to move. highly recommend. ps, it's easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hanks

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put together!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have full use of my hands and do not have a workshop in which to work on this thing. The parts don't seem to go together as described in the instructions. I will keep trying! I'm really just not very handy...
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Poor design and use of tolerances. Have to use a hammer to get things to "fit". I design down-hole oil drilling tools for a living. Not even the washers fit over the wheel shaft properly on one side. Ended up using a hand drill to open up the inside diameter of the washer some to fit over the shaft. Simple design flaws. Will upgrade or downgrade a star based on performance when I actually get to use it.
customer_reviews.author: KC Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with no holes for cotter pin.  Useless!
customer_reviews.text: The bar that holds the wheels did not have a hole in them for the cotter pin. Completely useless. Called number of manufacturer and they would not send part and said to contact reseller. No help. Just had to go through trouble of reboxing and returning.
customer_reviews.author: C. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Shipped usps
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with item. Said would ship prime (Im a prime member) but from the Amazon factory it shipped usps which boggles my mind. Very rural town and ups at my place several times a week. Amazon is killing the usps! This was a big package and caused delivery issues imo
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Held 4 bags of 80lb concrete without any problem. Moved a stove from 2nd floor to a garage without any problem. As long as care is taken to not abuse it, this hand truck is incredible. I'm really happy with it. +The little steel bar near the big wheels works as a fantastic support handle when 2 people are needed to move something to lift or descend/ascend. So 2 people have good grip, which I'm happy about. Be safe though, you only have one good back!
customer_reviews.author: R. Vlk

customer_reviews.title: Affordable hand trucks with built-in back rails for handling stairs
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and easy to assemble with very good instructions . I first used these to take a stack of three cases of beer down a flight of stairs. They work great my only regret is that I should have put a strap around the top case to keep it from tilting. Much lighter than even aluminum hand trucks. Also they conveniently convert into a handcart! Can't beat them for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Verell

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Easy to Switch; Easy to Move
customer_reviews.text: Handcart was good for moving our friend's apartment. We took the rail off and used as a dolly with a handle, as a chair (don't do that! LOL) and as a hand truck. Probably the smoothest handtruck that I've used in my 20 something moves. Would buy again, sturdy enough so I do not have to!
customer_reviews.author: Gwendalyn Starr

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This hand truck had exactly the versatility and functionality I was looking for. The only criticism I might offer is that moving the hand from the "truck" position to the 4-wheel cart position can be a slight struggle to align the handle with the holes, but that problem is resolved fairly quickly. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Great constable hand truck/dolly will make moving easier!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little hand truck/dolly coverable for less than a dedicated aluminum hand truck. Easy to assemble and maneuver, and you will be surprised at how often you will use it in the dolly configuration. Only thing preventing 5 stars is as a dolly, the base is open so it is not a good platform. You need to add a flat surface on it to carry small items or they will fall thru. But that's a minor gripe on an otherwise well built hand truck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second buy, missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase of this product as we really liked the first one and had multiple locations we were using it in. Just seemed easier to buy a second one. This one showed up and the tape on the box was barely holding it but the box seemed fine. Upon opening it, we realized the only thing inside was the cart and wheels.... no pins, screws for wheels, etc. Super bummed. Great first product, disappointed in packaging of the second.
customer_reviews.author: Alysia

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Light, and Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Great Price, Made in USA, super lightweight. I like the rails on the back which help with going up and down stairs. I use it to move my generator so can't vouch if it will actually handle 400 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Tailor Made

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight plastic. Not super strong.
customer_reviews.text: For $60 this thing is just fine. I'd NEVER attempt to move a fridge with it. The frame is plastic and the wheels are plastic. For your average homeowner, this should work fine. But I know it will break if you surpass the 300lb limit on 2 wheels or the 400lb limit on 4.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Used to move around heavy boxes and furniture. Seems very sturdy so far. Maneuvering by dragging it behind is easier since the rotating wheels are on the handle side. No complaints and love the ability to convert between hand truck and dolly.
customer_reviews.author: GrKe

customer_reviews.title: Tiny platform plastic wheels
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together except for the tires. They are supposed to be rubber but they are plastic and I think with multiple uses they will break or crack. The platform is very small. Would up using as a flat hauler. I am going to return it for the larger in this series. If I can disassemble it.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: Came with some of the plastic base broken. Didn't return it because it didn't impact its use. The nose plate is very narrow which will make moving larger items difficult. It's light but also very wobbly. There are far better hand trucks out there for this price. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Haveles

customer_reviews.title: Great... If only used on smoothest of floors.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like the perfect cart. The first problem I encountered was the steel lift plate would not assemble correctly with the wheel axle without excessive binding for the rotation of the large wheels. The company did send me a new replacement plate quickly which worked fine. Problem #1 solved. The versatile design is great. Works well. I wanted to love this cart... Except for the major flaw others have described. When cart is used in flat 4-wheel orientation the small wheels will wear very quickly and disintegrate on concrete, asphalt or any semi-rough surface. Problem #2 is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: M. G.

customer_reviews.title: light weight,  flexible uses and it all compact
customer_reviews.text: The best thing I liked about this was the flexible uses to move things around in my garage. Instead of buying a generator wheel kit - this little number does the trick +++ , plus I can use it for may other things. In other words its not a 1 trick pony .
customer_reviews.author: kcave

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but with a 400 lb. Capacity.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this at work at a trade show several years ago. I took pictures of it so I could find it online when I needed it. I use it to move stuff around the house and also to transport my drums in and out of the gigs. Good for gardening, lugging stuff from car to garden, moving heavy stuff everywhere. Must be assembled, wheels on axle and mounted to the frame. Simple.
customer_reviews.author: LarryDRice

customer_reviews.title: Apartment resident must have
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I live on the fifth floor of an apartment building. We bought this dolly when we moved in. It took a beating during the move. Converting this between dolly to cart mode has been great. We take our trash can to the dumpster, and run shopping items from car to fifth floor. This thing makes our life style much more easy.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made, Broke upon first use
customer_reviews.text: My husband was using this product to move a basketball goal. The plastic wheel busted. This was the first time the product was used after removing from original box. Do not purchase this product if you want quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kinsey Altman

customer_reviews.title: Very stri
customer_reviews.text: Love it it works great easy to handle and adjust format four wheels on ground vs two. Angles of struts allow for easy use of bungee chords. Light weight and quiet! Seems very sturdy and has small footprint. Great buy and design.
customer_reviews.author: David Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Multi-purpose Cart
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cart. I struggled a bit with assembly but I got it after a few tries. It's sturdy enough for my needs, rolls easily and I love that I can convert it from dolly style to flatbed style quickly and easily. Definitely worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: CEH

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to turn and maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream. Maneuvers easily and around corners. Used to haul a boxed bed shipped into the house and if you buy the bungee cord you can stack multiple tubs and items. Bought it for a move. Best Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Mallow

customer_reviews.title: Fits The Bill For Moving Small Objects
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for moving large ceramic pots full of plants out of harms way during hurricanes. I like the versatility of both handtruck for tall pots and the dolly for squat pots. it is easily converted from dolly to handtruck.
customer_reviews.author: RonHenry

customer_reviews.title: Really good item but missing bolt
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed!!! Good price hope it would work really good but, 4 bolt, 2 cotter pins, four nuts and the 2 locking pins did not came in the box won’t be able to assembly, maybe was lost box was open. Guess will have to see if I can purchase the bolt and other thing to try to assembly...
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is not a purchase you'll feel good about. This is a peice of junk that'll I'll always wonder when itll break on me. Both sets of wheel are the cheapest possible and will need to be fixed somehow, sometime soon. Not to mention the guy in charge of counting to 2 must have had to much on his plate and only gave me one wheel pin. So my wheel is currently held on by a zip tie, and ironically is probably the sturdiest part of this junk
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Bielicki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Dolly
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I recently moved ourselves home as I was getting out of the military. I decided it was smarter to buy a dolly than rent one. So happy that I purchased this one! We had the entire 26 foot moving truck loaded in 2 hours flat. Awesome product, 1000% recommended. Sturdy, versatile, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Marinelli

customer_reviews.title: Great value; Incredible Hand Truck
customer_reviews.text: I used this hand truck for moving from a third story apartment up and down stairs for several days and this hand truck takes a beating. The wheels are just large enough (and soft enough) to go down stairs with ease and the flat bed is robust enough to take several heavy boxes at once. This hand truck is incredibly lightweight and was indispensable for moving...I would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: LCPEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got this to make it easier to carry things from my car to my apartment. I gotta say that the smaller wheels when you lay it flat suck. They go all over the place and it’s difficult going over small crevices on the sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: Hardaman family

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand truck/cart!! It easily conveys from one to the other. It wasn't too had to put together, just needed a wrench & a pair of pliers. I used it to move my daughter from her college apartment to a townhouse & it was a life/ back saver!! I didn't test it to 800 pounds or anything like that but it held her bookshelf (with the help of some straps) perfectly! Then converted it to the cart and moves all the boxes. I love the fact that you adjust the height of the handle, it's a plus! Is definitely recommend it to others. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Melanie W.

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great...
customer_reviews.text: What I dislike about the dolly is that the 2 front wheels do not move freely and doesn't move at all. For that reason it is hard to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: rosemarie sanfilippo

customer_reviews.title: Harper Trucks Lightweight 400.
customer_reviews.text: Thank you. Thank you. Bought as used but this dolly delivered looking brand spanking new. I'm beyond thrilled and far exceeded my expectations. Money was tight and this was and still is soooo perfect. Sturdy, well built and looks brand new. Thank you. Im so happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous5

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I like it's very easy to put together. Easy to load and move but there's just one issue it has no locking systems, wish it did it's very hard to get things off without someone holding it. That would make this a ten star. Made in America???? Should have more quality. Nonetheless it works but.
customer_reviews.author: Truth@Real..

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little cart, especially the versatility of it going from upright to flat. Mine came fully assembled with the exception of the handle, depending on which way you choose to use it. Unfortunately, I did not snap on of the handle pins fully locked in one cold day & lost a pin. However, it works fins with only on, but obviously 2 are more secure. I just called Harper Trucks and told them I lost one pin and could not find a replacement pin. I wanted to obtain 1 and have a back up pin as well. The customer service woman was AWESOME, they are mailing me a few. 5 starts LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Handy hand truck
customer_reviews.text: Works well for home & garage needs. Assembly is required but not too bad. Very easy to put in the bed of mid-size truck and carry to destinations to unload payload. Stores easy when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly shouldn't have been so hard...
customer_reviews.text: Four stars because I had the devil's own time aligning the "axle" since the holes didn't line up. Finally had to hammer it into place. I hate having to fight with something to assemble it. Oh yah, the cotter pins were a PITA to open; more hammering. It is a nice looking dolly. I'm a 67 y/o female who worked for 20 years as a stationary equipment mechanic so this is my honest opinion.
customer_reviews.author: lynnsantabarbara

customer_reviews.title: while it technically does hold 400lbs the cheap plastic wheels ...
customer_reviews.text: while it technically does hold 400lbs the cheap plastic wheels will break if you have much less than that and run into a bump. wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great, lightweight and fairly sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Great for moving amps and stuff around.. easy peasy.. the pins that go in the wheels are a little goofy but tap them in with a hammer to spread the pins out (its the only way to get them to stay in.. if you didn't realize this) even after hammering them in you can still take them out by just pulling them a bit with your hands so you can pop those off and screw on the dolly attachment if you ever take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Neverdweller

customer_reviews.title: One tough hand truck!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and holds all the weight noted! Love this little truck - great for moving boxes of paper and stuff used in our office. Our dog loves it too - she climbs on the "wagon part" - can't sleep there, but she can get a great ride!
customer_reviews.author: TexasTaxMan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight cart!
customer_reviews.text: This was difficult to put together, because of some mislocated axle holes. With a few impromptu adjustments, I was able to get it together. I just packed up and moved my apartment using this dolly... it worked well, even going up and down multiple sets of stairs. Tough, light, very maneuverable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: A must have item
customer_reviews.text: This hand truck was the perfect size sturdiness I was looking for. It was light weight so I had no problem picking up and it’s very easy to maneuver with. Melissa
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Thicklin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to convert
customer_reviews.text: My contractor was very happy I had this hand truck. Turned it into a dolly and moved several 100# of tile to new shower. Easy to put together and change from truck to dolly in minutes. Great product and easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: GoodSaver

customer_reviews.title: Super light, totally recommend
customer_reviews.text: Super light, I can lift with one hand. Bought it for my house, but also use for work. Already had someone try to claim it at work. Goes easily around corners. Very durable. Would recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Kleine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! Easy to put together and has been great for cleaning out my garage!!! Love you can use it multiple ways. Easy to change up. Works greaa
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Great for a teacher.
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a school teacher. This is perfect for her to move her stuff in and out of her classroom each year. Not sure it would be great for moving a refrigerator but that was not our need.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Fairless

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Strong For Large Items
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and serves as a dual purpose 4-wheel cart or 2-wheel dolly. One item of concern is the spacing of the cross rails on the bed. Small heavy boxes or packages of about 1"x1"x1" will fall through unless some kind of platform is used. This is especially the case when it is used as a 4-wheel cart. Larger boxes or packages of at least 18" on one side should not be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Golfer Walt

customer_reviews.title: A good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are not very clear, but if an 83 year old woman can assemble it, it must not be too difficult. I wish they had included enough washers, but other than that, it is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Perky

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today. took 5 minutes to assemble. so easy! 4 bolts and nuts, 1 rod for wheels and washer and cotter pin. Walla! Done! Perfect product for my needs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Santanlady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect & very good price
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as advertised; lightweight, but really sturdy. Adjusts super-easy from upright to cart style and handle adjusts easily to make taller and shorter. Worked great for moving kid to college and so compact, I've kept it in the back of my Equinox ever since because it comes in handy a lot.
customer_reviews.author: K8t K.

customer_reviews.title: Great dolly/trolly
customer_reviews.text: I use this to move a bunch of totes. This is a great little cart. Just be smart and don't push it past its weight limit of 400 lb this unit is not designed to move a fridge or anything bake like that. But for basic general purpose it does great
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Anthony Loftus

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made product!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product! Used only a few times, then with only 150lbs. on it the wheel snapped. Tried to contact manufacturer to get replacement and was told I had to pay $45.00 to get a new back wheel. I bought the dolly for $50.00
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: A most convenient product
customer_reviews.text: Extremely light. I can't believe I didn't buy something like this years ago. Makes moving things so much easier. And it's mostly plastic except for the handles and bottom plate, so you don't scratch up your belongings in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Good !
customer_reviews.text: Great little hand truck for the price. I need to figure out a good way to strap my stuff to it. I have no complaints, it's just the right size for me and it fits in the front seat of my car so when my trunk is full it's still not an issue. It says it can handle up to 400 lbs but I'd limit it to maybe 150 really. But perfect for what I need to cart around
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: the wheels that should swivel easily do not turn at all...
customer_reviews.text: When using this on hardwood floor, the wheels did not swivel and scratched the floor. It is basically useless as a cart.. maybe a two wheeler.. but it is supposed to do both functions
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M Lund

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the price- lighter than a traditional hand truck, but still carries a fair amount of weight. Moved a large, old, refrigerator with it and it performed fine. No wear and tear at all, and I was concerned about it. Moved it by myself. Haven’t tried it in the 4-wheel mode, but I think it will work fine. Everything seems to be of good quality. Overall 4.0 rating. Not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Put the metal plate on before you put the wheels on. Assembly instructions will tell you to put the wheels on, then put the plate on. You cannot securely fasten the metal plate because the wheels are in the way. Put the plate and wheels per assembly instructions, just reverse the steps outlined in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Everyday use perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best money you'll spend for an everyday use around the house Dolly/cart/handtruck all in one. I use it and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis G.

customer_reviews.title: This convertible "truck" was perfect! It held up nicely
customer_reviews.text: I needed a very light weight dolly to haul some bins and gridwalls into/out of craft shows. This convertible "truck" was perfect! It held up nicely, and my mother and I can easily lift it to keep in the car. I piled 5 bins and a lot of extra things on it and hauled it in the venue. It has a lot of spaces to attach bungee cords, which helped for our big loads. It arrived in a few pieces. Without reading the instructions, I had it put together in less than 10 minutes. I love this dolly, and it's price tag! Great Buy!
customer_reviews.author: JustJill

customer_reviews.title: I love this. It makes moving easier
customer_reviews.text: I really like this dolly. It's 2 in one. The only thing I didn't like is putting it together. I need some kind of tool to bend one of the metal on the bottom to lock it otherwise the wheels kept coming off. A tutorial for that would be awesome!
customer_reviews.author: K. R. Gabales

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't mention it with a star, but the little pins that hold the bar in place come out very easily, but since i don't care about that, this did exactly what i needed it to and the cost was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: David Richmond

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this a few days ago, and so far so good! I actually used it today to move some heavy Amazon boxes from my door, and it's so much better than having to lug heavy boxes to the livingroom!
customer_reviews.author: StrongWoman

customer_reviews.title: Great but needs a floor
customer_reviews.text: Was difficult to put together at first but I finally got it done. They had the yellow handles jammed in to tight. I had to bang it out with a hammer. Love it though but wish it had a solid floor
customer_reviews.author: D. Shorter

product_meta.title: Harper Trucks Lightweight 400 lb Capacity Glass Filled Nylon Plastic Convertible Hand Truck and Dolly
product_meta.description:
Harper Trucks exclusive I-Beam Steel-Tough glass filled nylon plastic truss is 30% lighter than steel and designed to be as strong as steel or aluminum hand trucks. Built-in frame glides for easy moving up or down stairs and curbs. 8" wheels with solid rubber tread and 3" swivel casters for easy maneuverability. Made in USA. Frame factory assembled - Requires easy assembly of wheels and base plate.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Harper Trucks exclusive I-Beam Steel-Tough nylon truss is 30% lighter than steel and designed to be as strong as steel or aluminum hand trucks. Built-in stair glides for easy moving up or down stairs and curbs. 8" wheels with solid rubber tread and 3" swivel casters for easy maneuverability. Made in USA. Frame factory assembled - Requires easy assembly of wheels and base plate. Since 1940, Harper Trucks' mission has been to sell the highest quality products in the market. We have grown from a small, regional metal fabricator to the largest hand truck manufacturer in the world. As the world's largest manufacturer of hand trucks, Harper makes one of every three such trucks sold in the United States. Harper Trucks are manufactured in a plant of 400,000 square feet with full robotic and new composite-injection capabilities.
feature_bullets: Manufactured in USA; Harper exclusive I-Beam Glass Filled Nylon Plastic Frame is 30% lighter than steel and designed for maximum strength
Plastic Frame is factory assembled and is chemical, corrosion and rust resistant for longer life
Converts in seconds from 2 wheel dolly to 4 wheel cart - 300 lb dolly and 400 lb cart capacity (Product images illustrates both uses, but only one cart is being sold)
8" wheels with solid rubber tread and 3" swivel casters
Three position telescoping handle, built-in frame glides for easy moving up or down stairs and curbs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,988 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
